revision.comment: [[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], [[WP:AWB/T|typo(s) fixed]]: march 1790) → March 1790), crusing → cruising, january → January using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox military person | honorific_prefix = | name = Rudolf Cederström | honorific_suffix = | image = Olof Rudolf Cederström Riksarkivet horizontal flip.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | birth_name = Olof Rudolf Cederström | nickname = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1764|02|08|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Landskrona]], Sweden | death_date = {{Death date and age|1833|06|01|1764|02|08|df=y}} | death_place = [[Funbo]], Sweden | placeofburial = | placeofburial_label = | placeofburial_coordinates = | allegiance = | branch = [[Swedish Navy]] | serviceyears = 1779–1828 | rank = General admiral | servicenumber = | unit = | commands = | battles = [[Russo-Swedish War (1788–90)]]
*[[Battle of Hogland]] *[[Battle of Reval]] *[[Battle of Vyborg Bay (1790)|Battle of Viborg Bay]] [[First Barbary War]] *[[First Battle of Tripoli Harbor]] [[Russian occupation of Gotland 1808|Russian occupation of Gotland]] | battles_label = | awards = | memorials = | spouse = | relations = | laterwork = | signature = | signature_size = | signature_alt = | website = | module = }} '''Olof Rudolf Cederström''' (8 February 1764 – 1 June 1833) was a naval commander, hired by the [[Sweden|Swedish]] admiralty in 1779. In 1790 he conducted a raid against [[Paldiski|Rogervik]]. He distinguished himself in 1790 at the naval [[Battle of Reval]] and the [[Battle of Vyborg Bay (1790)|Battle of Viborg Bay]]. During the following years he led ships against [[English people|English]] [[privateer]]s in the [[North Sea]]. He was sent in 1801 to fight alongside the [[United States Navy]] in the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean]] during the [[First Barbary War]]. In 1808 his ships were sent to blockade [[Gotland]] in order to repel the [[Russian Empire|Russia]]n invaders. His last military action was against [[Denmark-Norway|Denmark]] and [[First French Empire|France]] in 1813, when he helped Swedish forces capture [[Vorpommern]]. In 1815 he was appointed a minister, but returned to the navy in 1818, and resigned in 1828. ==Career== Cederström was born in [[Landskrona]], Sweden, the son of Claes Cederström and his wife Margareta Elisabet von Mevius. He was a student in [[Uppsala]] in 1776 and was admitted to war service at the Admiralty in 1779. Cederström became a non-commissioned officer (''arklimästare'') at the Admiralty on 3 August 1779 and was promoted to ''[[Fänrik#History and related ranks in Sweden|fänrik]]'' on 5 June 1781. In 1784 he became harbourmaster in [[Saint Barthélemy]] and on 15 August 1785 he was promoted to ''[[löjtnant]]''. Cederström was promoted to ''[[kapten]]'' on 21 July 1788.{{Harvnb|Adelsvapen||loc=[https://www.adelsvapen.com/genealogi/Cederstr%C3%B6m_nr_135#TAB_10 Cederström nr 135]}} He distinguished himself during the [[Russo-Swedish War (1788–90)|Russo-Swedish War]] 1788–90 and conducted where he conducted a successful expedition to [[Paldiski|Rogervik]] (17 March 1790) as the commander of a small squadron of two frigates and a few brigs,{{harvnb|Hofberg|Heurlin|Millqvist|Rubenson|1880|pp=176–177}} where timber to a Russian archipelago fleet and much other military equipment was destroyed.{{harvnb|Linder|1880|pp=130–131}} For this he was appointed [[Major (Sweden)|major]] on 26 March 1790. Cederström also distinguished himself during the [[Battle of Reval]] (13 May 1790) and the [[Battle of Vyborg Bay (1790)|Battle of Vyborg Bay]] (4 July 1790). He became ''[[överstelöjtnant]]'' at the Admiralty on 25 February 1793. Cederström became a member of the Committee of the Navy's Equipment on 22 April 1794 and ''[[överste]]'' at the Admiralty on 21 June 1795. In 1796 and in 1798 he was cruising with a frigate squadron in the [[North Sea]] to protect the Nordic trade against the English [[privateer]]s.. He was appointed commanding officer of the High Seas Navy (''Örlogsflottan'') on 6 April 1801 and was three days later promoted to rear admiral. Cederström was sent with a squadron to the Mediterranean to punish [[Ottoman Tripolitania|Tripolitanian]] pirates during the [[First Barbary War]]. After 20 months he made peace with [[Tripoli]]. In 1808 he took command of a squadron, which had the task of protecting the Swedish coast against a feared French-Danish landing. Also in 1808, [[Russian occupation of Gotland 1808|Russia occupied the island of Gotland]] and a Swedish relief expedition under the command of Cederström was dispatched from Karlskrona to repel the Russians invadors from the island, which was executed within three days. The Russian occupation accelerated, however, the establishment of the [[Gotland National Conscription]] and Cederström was commissioned as vice governor of the island to implement this arming of the people and to set the island in a state of defense against a feared attack by the English. Cederström was promoted to vice admiral on 29 June 1809 and he was military commander of [[Gotland]] from 13 August 1810 to 24 September 1811. In 1813 he was appointed general commander of the entire Swedish naval force against [[Denmark–Norway|Denmark]] and the [[First French Empire|French]] allies, and in 1814, for a short time, over the naval force against [[Norway]]. Cederström was general commander of [[Guadeloupe]] in 1814 and was on duty as [[adjutant]] of the fleets on 5 August 1815. Cederström became minister (''statsråd'') on 8 August 1815 and the [[Over-Governor of Stockholm]] and acting chancellor of the [[Military Academy Karlberg|Royal War Academy]] on 30 July 1816. He was promoted to admiral on 24 November 1818 and resigned as the Over-Governor of Stockholm on 15 December 1818. He received the title [[Count]] on 11 May 1819 and was promoted to ''överamiral'' on 1 June 1820 and was appointed [[Lord of the Realm]] on 5 November 1821. Cederström was promoted to [[general admiral]] and was appointed commanding officer of the Naval Artillery Regiment (''Sjöartilleriregementet'') on 7 October 1823. He was also appointed commanding officer of the [[Swedish Navy|Royal Majesty's Fleet]], which according Cederström's proposals formed by merging the High Seas Navy (''Örlogsflottan'') and the [[Archipelago fleet|Fleet of the Army]]. On this post, he was the victim of many attacks from parliament and the press side for dubious economic trades of war ships from the navy, which led to his resignation in 1828 "at the end of his brilliant career". He then became an honorary member of the Uppsala County Agricultural Society on 28 January 1829. ==Personal life== On 16 February 1793 he married in [[Karlskrona]] to countess Charlotta Catharina Wrangel af Sauss (7 October 1767 in Karlskrona - 4 February 1848 in Lövsta), the daughter of the [[Lord of the Realm]], First Admiral, Count Anton Johan Wrangel af Sauss and Countess Charlotta Regina Sparre af Söfdeborg. His last years, he lived on the estate Lövsta in [[Uppland County]]. Cederström died on 1 June 1833 at Lövsta in Funbo Parish, Uppsala County. He was the father of: *Claes Anton (born 1795). Became count when his father died. *Margareta-Charlotta (25 November 1796 in Karlskrona - 21 June 1883 in Karlskrona). She married on 25 November 1814 to Rear Admiral, Count Claes August Cronstedt (1785-1860). *Gustaf Adolf (born 1797) *Olof Rudolf (born 1800) *Carl-Emanuel (born 1804) *Fredrik Ture (born 1808) ==Awards and decorations== Cederström's awards: *Knight of the [[Order of the Sword]] (26 March 1790) *Commander of the [[Order of the Sword]] (16 November 1799) *Commander Grand Cross of the [[Order of the Sword]] (13 June 1803) *Honorary member of the [[Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences]] (9 December 1809) *Knight Grand Cross 2nd Class of the [[Order of the Sword]] (9 August 1814) *Knight and Commander of the [[Royal Order of the Seraphim|Orders of His Majesty the King]] (7 October 1816) *[[Order of Charles XIII]] (28 January 1825) ==Citations== {{Commonscat|Olof Rudolf Cederström}} märkvärdiga namn, föremål och begrepp |first=N. |last=Linder |year=1880 |location=Stockholm |language=sv |id={{LIBRIS|78095}} |ref=harv}} *{{cite book |last=Hofberg |first=Herman |last2=Heurlin reformationen till nuvarande tid |url=http://runeberg.org/sbh/a0176.html |edition=Ny uppl. /grundligt genomsedd, omarbetad och till våra dagar framförd af Frithiof Heurlin ... |year=1906 |publisher=Bonnier |location=Stockholm |language=sv |id={{LIBRIS|81312}} |ref=harv}} *{{cite web |url=https://www.adelsvapen.com/genealogi/Cederstr%C3%B6m_nr_135#TAB_10 |publisher=Adelsvapen
